input_sentence: If ego Vehicle is driving behind another vehicle then it must maintain a safe distance until ego can overtake the other vehicle safely.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle is driving behind other vehicle
Ego maintains safe distance from other vehicle
Ego can overtake other vehicle safely

temporal_relations.description: If ego is driving behind other, then it must maintain safe distance until it can overtake safely

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct predicate(object1, object2) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: driving_behind(ego,other)
   - ap_2: maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) 
   - ap_3: can_overtake_safely(ego,other)

3. Analyze temporal relation: "conditional_until" with antecedent "ap_1" and consequent "ap_2 U ap_3"
   - This maps to: driving_behind(ego,other) -> (maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) U can_overtake_safely(ego,other))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator to the entire conditional

5. No metric constraints specified, so use unbounded until operator U (without time interval)

Final MTL Formula:
G (driving_behind(ego,other) -> (maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) U can_overtake_safely(ego,other)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct predicate(object1, object2) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: driving_behind(ego,other)
   - ap_2: maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) 
   - ap_3: can_overtake_safely(ego,other)

3. Analyze temporal relation: "conditional_until" with antecedent "ap_1" and consequent "ap_2 U ap_3"
   - This maps to: driving_behind(ego,other) -> (maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) U can_overtake_safely(ego,other))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator to the entire conditional

5. No metric constraints specified, so use unbounded until operator U (without time interval)

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
The formula G (driving_behind(ego,other) -> (maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) U can_overtake_safely(ego,other))) uses a global operator with an implication containing an until operator. 

- G: translates to "Always" indicating this condition must hold at all times
- driving_behind(ego,other): relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle is driving behind another vehicle"
- maintains_safe_distance(ego,other): relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle maintains safe distance from another vehicle"  
- can_overtake_safely(ego,other): relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle can overtake another vehicle safely"
- ->: implication operator translates to "if...then"
- U: until operator indicates the first condition must hold continuously until the second condition becomes true

The until operator here has no explicit time bounds, so it applies indefinitely until the overtaking condition is satisfied.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is driving behind another vehicle, then the ego vehicle must maintain safe distance from the other vehicle until the ego vehicle can overtake the other vehicle safely.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is driving behind another vehicle, then the ego vehicle must maintain safe distance from the other vehicle until the ego vehicle can overtake the other vehicle safely.

The formula G (driving_behind(ego,other) -> (maintains_safe_distance(ego,other) U can_overtake_safely(ego,other))) uses a global operator with an implication containing an until operator. 

- G: translates to "Always" indicating this condition must hold at all times
- driving_behind(ego,other): relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle is driving behind another vehicle"
- maintains_safe_distance(ego,other): relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle maintains safe distance from another vehicle"  
- can_overtake_safely(ego,other): relational predicate meaning "ego vehicle can overtake another vehicle safely"
- ->: implication operator translates to "if...then"
- U: until operator indicates the first condition must hold continuously until the second condition becomes true

The until operator here has no explicit time bounds, so it applies indefinitely until the overtaking condition is satisfied.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
